Activities Application

Database models for the activities application.

This module defines the Activity and Enrollment models. Activities represent events or services offered to families, while enrollments represent a child’s participation in a specific activity.

class activities.models.Activity(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases : Model

Model representing an activity.

title

The title of the activity (French verbose name: “Titre”).

Type:

CharField

description

Optional description of the activity (French verbose name: “Description”).

Type:

TextField

fee

Fee for the activity in euros (French verbose name: “Tarif (€)”).

Type:

DecimalField

start_date

Optional start date of the activity (French verbose name: “Date de début”).

Type:

DateField

end_date

Optional end date of the activity (French verbose name: “Date de fin”).

Type:

DateField

capacity

Optional maximum number of participants (French verbose name: “Capacité”).

Type:

PositiveIntegerField

is_active

Indicates whether the activity is active (French verbose name: “Active”).

Type:

BooleanField

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases : MultipleObjectsReturned

enrollments

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>

Model representing an enrollment of a child in an activity.

The child enrolled (related to families.Child).

class Status(*values)[source]

Bases : TextChoices

Enumeration of enrollment statuses.

PENDING_PAYMENT

Enrollment has been created but payment is pending.

CONFIRMED

Enrollment has been confirmed.

CANCELLED

Enrollment has been cancelled.

PENDING_PAYMENT = 'PENDING_PAYMENT'
CONFIRMED = 'CONFIRMED'
CANCELLED = 'CANCELLED'
child

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

property invoice: Invoice

Return the invoice associated with an enrollment, creating it on demand.

Paramètres:

enroll (Enrollment) – The enrollment instance for which the invoice is required.

Renvoie:

The invoice instance, newly created if it did not exist.

Type renvoyé:

Invoice

Notes

  • Uses activity.fee as the default amount when creating the invoice.

  • This function ensures that templates and tests accessing enroll.invoice will never raise RelatedObjectDoesNotExist.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>

Views for the activities application.

This module defines class-based views for listing activities, displaying details, managing enrollments, and handling enrollment creation with integration to enrollment and billing gateways.

class activities.views.ActivityListView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases : ListView

View for listing all active activities.

Displays only activities that are active and whose start date is greater than or equal to the current date.

template_name = 'activities/activity_list.html'
context_object_name = 'activities'
get_queryset()[source]

Return the queryset of activities to be displayed.

Renvoie:

Active activities starting today or later.

Type renvoyé:

QuerySet

class activities.views.ActivityDetailView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases : DetailView

View for displaying the details of a single activity.

Adds context information about whether enrollment is allowed and provides an enrollment form if the user is authenticated.

model

alias de Activity

template_name = 'activities/activity_detail.html'
context_object_name = 'activity'
get_context_data(**kwargs)[source]

Extend the context with enrollment form and availability flag.

Paramètres:

**kwargs (dict) – Additional context data passed from the superclass.

Renvoie:

Context dictionary with keys: - can_enroll: bool indicating if enrollment is possible. - form: EnrollmentForm instance for authenticated users.

Type renvoyé:

dict

class activities.views.EnrollmentListView(**kwargs)[source]

Requires login and displays enrollments associated with the user’s children.

class activities.views.EnrollView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases : LoginRequiredMixin, View

Handle creation of an enrollment and associated invoice.

Enrollment is created through the configured enrollment gateway, and a billing record is generated using the billing gateway.

post(request, pk)[source]

Handle POST request to enroll a child in an activity.

Paramètres:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request containing enrollment data.

  • pk (int) – The primary key of the activity to enroll in.

Renvoie:

A redirection response to either the detail page, enrollment list, or verification page.

Type renvoyé:

HttpResponse

Forms for the activities application.

This module defines form classes used to handle user input related to enrollments in activities. Forms integrate with Django’s form system and provide validation and UI customization.

class activities.forms.EnrollmentForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases : ModelForm

Form for creating an enrollment in an activity.

This form allows a parent to select one of their children and enroll them in an activity. The available children are restricted to those associated with the authenticated user.

child

A dropdown field that lets the user choose one of their children for the enrollment. It uses a browser-default style for compatibility without requiring JavaScript.

Type:

forms.ModelChoiceField

class Meta[source]

Bases : object

Type:

Model

fields

The fields exposed to the form, here only “child”.

Type:

list

property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

Gateways for enrollment management.

This module defines abstractions and implementations of gateways responsible for creating and synchronizing enrollments. A gateway can operate locally or interact with an external WCS (Web Citizen Service) backend. All implementations follow a common interface to allow interchangeable use.

class activities.gateways.EnrollmentGateway(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases : Protocol

Protocol for enrollment gateways.

Any enrollment gateway must implement the create_enrollment method to create or retrieve an enrollment associated with an activity and a child.

create_enrollment(*, activity, child)[source]

Create or retrieve an enrollment for a given activity and child.

Paramètres:

  • activity (Activity) – The activity in which the child should be enrolled.

  • child (Child) – The child being enrolled.

Renvoie:

A tuple of (enrollment instance, created flag).

Type renvoyé:

tuple

class activities.gateways.LocalEnrollmentGateway[source]

Bases : object

Local enrollment gateway implementation.

Handles enrollment creation directly in the local database without contacting external services.

create_enrollment(*, activity, child)[source]

Create or retrieve a local enrollment.

Paramètres:

  • activity (Activity) – The activity in which the child should be enrolled.

  • child (Child) – The child being enrolled.

Renvoie:

A tuple containing the enrollment and a boolean indicating whether it was created.

Type renvoyé:

tuple

class activities.gateways.WcsEnrollmentGateway(base_url=None, api_token=None, timeout_sec=5)[source]

Bases : object

Remote WCS enrollment gateway.

Provides integration with an external WCS service. It mirrors local enrollment creation to the WCS backend and can synchronize enrollment status. Features include robust error handling, configurable timeouts, and token-based authentication.

Paramètres:

  • base_url (str | None)

  • api_token (str | None)

  • timeout_sec (int)

base_url

The base URL of the WCS backend.

Type:

str, optional

api_token

The API token for authentication with WCS.

Type:

str, optional

timeout_sec

The timeout for HTTP requests, in seconds.

Type:

int

base_url: str | None = None
api_token: str | None = None
timeout_sec: int = 5
create_enrollment(*, activity, child)[source]

Create or retrieve an enrollment and mirror it to WCS.

Paramètres:

  • activity (Activity) – The activity in which the child should be enrolled.

  • child (Child) – The child being enrolled.

Renvoie:

A tuple containing the enrollment and a boolean indicating whether it was created.

Type renvoyé:

tuple

Lève:

EnrollmentCreationError – If the WCS backend request fails.

sync_enrollment(*, enrollment)[source]

Synchronize enrollment status from WCS.

Paramètres:

enrollment (Enrollment) – The local enrollment instance to synchronize.

Renvoie:

The updated enrollment instance.

Type renvoyé:

Enrollment

Lève:

EnrollmentSyncError – If synchronization with WCS fails.

activities.gateways.get_enrollment_gateway()[source]

Factory function to select the enrollment gateway.

Renvoie:

The enrollment gateway instance based on configuration. Defaults to local gateway if no backend is specified.

Type renvoyé:

EnrollmentGateway

Custom exceptions for the activities application.

This module defines domain-specific exceptions used for handling errors related to the enrollment process. These exceptions provide a structured way to signal and catch gateway-related failures.

exception activities.exceptions.EnrollmentError[source]

Bases : Exception

Base class for enrollment-related errors.

All custom exceptions related to enrollment inherit from this class. It can be used to catch any enrollment-specific error raised by the application.

exception activities.exceptions.EnrollmentCreationError[source]

Bases : EnrollmentError

Raised when remote enrollment creation fails.

Typically used when the gateway or backend service cannot process a new enrollment request successfully.

exception activities.exceptions.EnrollmentSyncError[source]

Bases : EnrollmentError

Raised when remote enrollment synchronization fails.

Typically used when the local enrollment state cannot be synchronized with the remote gateway or backend service.

URL configuration for the activities application.

This module defines all routes related to activities and enrollments. Each route maps to a class-based view that handles the corresponding HTTP requests.

activities.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern '' [name='list']>, <URLPattern '<int:pk>/' [name='detail']>, <URLPattern '<int:pk>/inscrire/' [name='enroll']>, <URLPattern 'inscriptions/' [name='enrollments']>]

URL patterns for the activities application
